Description.val:
This budget provides for the procurement of Strategic Weapons System (SWS) equipment for deployed ballistic missile submarines (SSBNs) and shore support sites to support the TRIDENT II (D5) program. Included are shipboard subsystem equipment modernization and technical refresh efforts associated with the TRIDENT II (D5) life extension program. TRIDENT II SSBN hull life has been extended, therefore extending system life to FY 2042.

OTHER MATERIAL SUPPORT
A broad range of other material support equipment must be procured for deployed SSBNs, shore installations and contractor facilities. Included within this category are general and special purpose test equipment, launcher expendables, navigation principal items, test instrumentation in support of missile flight tests, and missile checkout equipment.

ALTERATIONS
Alterations to non-flying tactical hardware are continuing requirements for the SWS. Requirements primarily relate to shipboard investments in Commercial-off-the-Shelf/Non-Developmental Items (COTS/NDI) SWS subsystem equipment, including periodic refresh cycles, to ensure continued reliable performance of the weapon system for its extended service life to match the OHIO Class life extension. Strategic Programs Alterations (SPALTs) also entail
the application of available technology to eliminate personnel safety hazards, correct design deficiencies, maintain system effectiveness by resolving equipment operability problems, achieve logistic economies, and provide for shipboard subsystem D5 life extension modernization efforts.

Funds are required to procure alterations to the SWS launcher and fire control subsystems; to inertial, non-inertial, and Electrostatic Gyro Navigator (ESGN) navigation subsystem equipment on deployed SSBNs and installed at supporting shore facilities, including the TRIDENT Training Facility (TTF), Bangor; TTF, Kings Bay; the Ashore Navigation Center; and the Inertial System Test Laboratory; to test instrumentation used on SSBNs, support ships, and at the Eastern Test Range, the TRIDENT Refit Facility (TRF), Bangor, and TRF, Kings Bay; and to missile handling equipment, missile test and readiness equipment, and surface support equipment. Installation of approved SPALTs is performed on a turnkey basis in conjunction with the procurement of equipment. Use of COTS/NDI has been initiated and is being implemented in all subsystems, wherever possible.

The majority of the Alterations funding supports the Shipboard System Integration (SSI) program which utilizes a COTS based strategy that integrates common electronics (from Fire Control, Launcher, and Navigation) into the fire control sub-system as well as refreshing inertial systems in order to ensure the TRIDENT II (D5) weapon system can be sustained to FY 2042 in support of OHIO Class SSBNs. Below is a description of each current SSI Increment (Inc):

SSI Inc 8: Inc 8 provides replacement of the 30 year old ESGN which needs a refresh of inertial technology components, provides replacement of the Electronic Equipment Consoles (EEC), and updates Navigation Subsystem software to accommodate ESGN replacement navigator. Also, provides SWS subsystem SPALTs for FC and TTF NAV Lab trainers, and SDS/DRS Software SPALT changes which are driven by data requirement changes. The SHIPALTs retain NAV Center bedplate, cabling, chilled water/ventilation, and retain electrical power.

SSI Inc 11: Inc 11 develops the Launcher Initiation System (LIS) for backfit onto OHIO Class D5LE. This provides a technical refresh of 30+ year old technology to ensure long term system reliability. Ship/SWSS SHIPALT is to replace electrical cable with hybrid fiber-optic/electrical cable.

SSI Inc 13: Inc 13 provides Shipboard Systems Refresh for FCS, NAV, and Missile Test and Readiness Equipment (MTRE) to integrate with the subsystems.

SSI Inc 15: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 13. Inc 15 provides pre-configuration and post-configuration support of Inc 8 and Inc 11. Inc 15 provides refresh alterations for fire control equipment, navigation, launcher, and trainer subsystems.

SSI Inc 16: Prerequisite is SSI Inc 15. Inc 16 provides Fire Control Subsystem refresh of SSI Inc 13 components, technical refresh of Shipboard Data System (SDS) subsystems, technical refresh of Navigation SSI Inc 4, technical refresh of Launcher Variable Energy Eject (VEE) actuators to address obsolescence to sustain the fleet. Inc 16 efforts also focus on capturing legacy fire control and navigation subsystem behavior to develop a functional model to inform future SSI increments.

TRAINING
This category provides for procurement of, and alterations to, both tactical and non-tactical equipment required at submarine training facilities to train personnel in the operation and maintenance of launcher and handling, fire control, navigation, missile checkout, and test instrumentation subsystems. Each training facility consists of an integrated family of system and unit laboratories that interface with a training simulation system to provide complete and realistic training for replacement and off-crew personnel, both officer and enlisted, as required for manning of SSBNs and shore facilities. Funding is budgeted to procure training-unique equipment required as the result of alterations to SWS tactical equipment, including those associated with D5 life extension.

COLUMBIA CLASS
Funding in this category is in support of the Columbia class SSBN for the procurement of trainer equipment.

Justification.val:
OTHER MATERIAL SUPPORT
A broad range of other material support equipment must be procured for deployed SSBNs, shore installations and contractor facilities. Included within this category are general and special purpose test equipment, launcher expendables, navigation principal items, test instrumentation in support of missile flight tests, and missile checkout equipment. Amounts included within this P1 line for this category are subdivided as follows:

Launcher and Handling Equipment: Cost code 1.2 funding in FY21 continues to procure 10 MK-74 Gas Generator (GG) units to support missile launch operations and the life extension of the GGs. Cost code 1.3 funding for the procurement and qualification of Gas Generator Case Hardware required to replace cases for expended/fired GGs. Funding in this category fluctuates year to year due to test schedules. Cost code 1.6 funding decreases as final ballast install support equipment is procured.

Fire Control Equipment: Cost code 2.1 funding in FY 2021 provides for procurement of continued capital maintenance projects at the Naval Industrial Reserve Ordnance Plant (NIROP) in Pittsfield, MA. These projects are essential to correct environmental, safety, and energy conservation deficiencies. NIROP improvements in FY21 include scheduled Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) compliance upgrades to three elevators. Cost code 2.2 reflects increased funding required for design maturity of Auxiliary Systems Technology Refresh (ASTR) #3. Cost code 2.4 provides a refresh of the existing SSP Advanced Inventory and Logistics (SAIL) system to include software and hardware procurements necessary for the system to meet Information Assurance (IA) compliance requirements. Cost code 2.6 funding provides procurement of hardware and software for the Shipboard Planning Operational Flexibility (SPOF, formerly referred to as RT-WEG) program, consisting of updates to the fire control system requested by USSTRATCOM to create a Submarine Launched Ballistic Missile (SLBM) flexibility and efficiency enhancement program. Additional information on this program can be provided at a higher classification level.

Navigation Equipment: Cost code 3.3 funding in FY20 completed factory test equipment refresh to Non-Inertial Navigation Sonar System (NSS) and the Frequency Standard module as well as a series of high complexity tests for non-inertial and inertial Navigation components. FY21 efforts procure system spares.

Instrumentation/Missile Test Equipment: Funding in all years provides for shore based and shipboard test instrumentation equipment in support of missile flight tests. Cost code 4.1 funds the procurement of umbilical cable shipsets which support the TRIDENT unique portion of the Range refresh of the Command Destruct Transmitter. Cost code 4.4 FY20 completed procurement of network encryption devices. Cost code 4.5 provides updates to the range safety systems that support TRIDENT II D5LE SSBN launch points for live fire missile launch operations. These systems are approaching their useful design life, and utilizing aging equipment introduces risk to the safety of all parties involved in live fire missile launch operations. 

Information Technology: Cost code 5.1 funding in all years provides for IT equipment acquisitions (hardware and related software) in support of the Strategic Systems Programs. This includes the IT hardware and software components connected to the Strategic Weapons System Network (SWSNET). FY21 decrease is due to the completion of required upgrades to telephone software and equipment to interface with Voice Over IP (VOIP) technology in FY20.

ALTERATIONS
Alterations to non-flying tactical hardware are continuing requirements for the SWS. Requirements relate primarily to shipboard investments in Commercial-off-the-Shelf/Non-Developmental Items (COTS/NDI) SWS subsystem equipment, including periodic refresh cycles, to ensure continued reliable performance of the weapon system for its extended service life to match the OHIO Class life extension. Strategic Programs Alterations (SPALTs) also entail the application of available technology to eliminate personnel safety hazards, correct design deficiencies, maintain system effectiveness by resolving equipment operability problems, achieve logistic economies, and provide for shipboard subsystem D5 life extension modernization efforts.

Funds are required to procure alterations to the SWS launcher and fire control subsystems; to inertial, non-inertial, and ESGN navigation subsystem equipment on deployed SSBNs and installed at supporting shore facilities, and to missile handling equipment, missile test and readiness equipment, and surface support equipment. Installation of approved SPALTs is performed on a turnkey basis in conjunction with the procurement of equipment. Use of COTS/NDI has been initiated and is being implemented in all subsystems, wherever possible.

Launcher and Handling Equipment: Cost code 6.4 increase from FY20 to FY21 due to the procurement of Launcher hardware for the Strategic Weapon System Ashore (SWSA) Test Facility. Other major Launcher SPALT activities include Maintenance Platform refresh, Ejector Group Handling Equipment (EGHE) refresh, Variable Energy Eject (VEE) Actuator refurbishment and Davit SPALT to address aging and obsolescence issues.

Fire Control Equipment: Cost code 7.1 funds the planned refresh of the Portable Computing Devices (PCD). PCDs are refreshed every 9 years, with the first year of the refresh cycle dedicated to PCD Development and Qualification tasks, and the second year for procurement and Acceptance Test. Cost code 7.2 funding in FY21 supports refreshes of the fire control software (FCS). Increase from FY20 to FY21 is due to the design maturation plus verification and validation required for FCS X56. This funding also accounts for all corresponding training, auxiliary system, fleet documentation products, and the FC software program system integrator role.

Navigation Equipment: Cost codes 8.3-8.4, the TSSS Transducer and the Navigation Software SPALT efforts, have undergone a comprehensive replan to account for delays in Inc 8 development and subsequent reduced scope of Inc 15. Funding in FY21 provides support for efforts in problem correction, fleet documentation, and system modeling and simulations related to the Navigation system. Transducer (non-inertial) and Navigation SPALTS are being procured to replace legacy equipment. Additionally, FY21 efforts will continue to support testing of Navigation software code. Cost code 8.3 funding for the procurement of TR-143A material and assembly, which replenish transducer stock for OHIO SSBNs, is reduced from FY 2020 to FY 2021. Cost code 8.4 provides funding in FY21 for Tactical and Trainer efforts for TR-E1 to begin. TR-E1 provides updates to the navigation software in order to resolve issues arising with Inc 8 initial outfitting. Cost code 8.6 in FY21, the program will begin development of the Broadband Navigation SONAR Navigation Sonar System (BBNS), which is transitioning from a Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) project to a production effort. This initiative will focus on the modernization and extension of the existing NNS technology developed in the 1970s and will remove operational constraints within current system and reduce sensitivity to operational environments. 

Instrumentation/Missile Checkout equipment: Cost code 9.1 FY21 funding provides for Forecast Instrumentation SPALT for hardware modification to submarine instrumentation of flight systems. 

The majority of the Alterations funding supports the Shipboard System Integration (SSI) program which utilizes a COTS based strategy that integrates common electronics (from Fire Control, Launcher, Navigation and Shipboard Data Recording Systems) into the fire control sub-system as well as refreshing inertial systems in order to ensure the TRIDENT II (D5) weapon system can be sustained to FY42 in support of OHIO Class SSBNs. 

Below is a description of each current SSI Increment (Inc):

SSI Inc 8: Inc 8 provides replacement of the 30 year old Electrostatic Gyro Navigator (ESGN) which needs a refresh of inertial technology components, replacement of the Electronic Equipment Consoles (EEC), and updates to Navigation Subsystem software to accommodate the ESGN replacement navigator. Also, provides SWS subsystem SPALTs for FCS and TTF NAV Lab trainers, and SDS/DRS Software SPALT changes which are driven by data requirement changes. The SHIPALTs retain NAV Center bedplate, cabling, chilled water/ventilation, and retain electrical power. The current ESGN was designed and deployed in the early 1980s with a 20 year designed service live. This refresh is critical to ensure the program continues to meet STRATCOM requirements, and to ensure the operational availability of the OHIO, VANGUARD, COLUMBIA and DREADNOUGHT SSBNs.

Inc 8 efforts in FY21 include:
-Cost code 10.3 funding for Gyroscope and Inertial Navigation System (INS)  performance and qualification testing; trainer integration testing and install
-Cost code 10.4 funding for support of Subsystem Qualifications and system Production Readiness Review (PRR)
-Cost code 10.5 funding for the procurement of 35 gyroscopes, plus life of type buy (LOTB) of critical optical components
-Cost Code 10.6 funding for the procurement of spares and On Board Repair Parts (OBRPs) required for deploying Inc 8 SPALT
-Cost Code 10.7 funding for the procurement of 9 INS builds
-Cost code 10.8 funding for SHIPALT installation planning and SHIPALT material kits

SSI Inc 11: Launcher Initiation System (LIS) is being developed for backfit onto OHIO Class D5LE. This provides a technical refresh of 30+ year old technology to ensure long term system reliability. SHIP/SWSS SHIPALT is to replace electrical cable with hybrid fiber-optic/electrical cable.

Inc 11 efforts in FY21 include:
-Cost code 11.5 funds the procurement of Launcher SSI Inc 11 two (2) shipsets of Laser Firing Units
-Cost code 11.6 funds the installation of Fiber Optic Cables
-Cost code 11.7 funds the installation of LIS SPALT kits

SSI Inc 13: Inc 13 provides Shipboard Systems Refresh for FCS, NAV, and Missile Test and Readiness Equipment (MTRE) for integration with the subsystems.

Inc 13 efforts in FY21 include:
-Cost code 12.1 funding MTRE refresh to integrate with Fire Control software changes for SSI Inc 13 
-Cost code 12.8 funds the procurement of Fire Control SSI Inc 13 Electronics' Refresh SPALTS Kits with a quantity 6
-Cost code 12.9 funds the installation of Inc 13 Fire Control and Navigation updates

SSI Inc 15: Inc 15 provides pre-configuration and post-configuration support of Inc 8 and Inc 11. Inc 15 is a critical path and the baseline for the deployment of the COLUMBIA Class SSBN. Inc 15 involves refreshes to several subsystems such as alterations for fire control equipment, navigation, launcher, and trainer subsystems. Due to the developmental challenges experienced for SSI Inc 8 during the engineering and test phase, Strategic Systems Programs (SSP) reduced the efforts of SSI Inc 15 to the minimally required effort to address obsolescence issues which are required for the SWS to be the initial baseline for the COLUMBIA class SSBN. 

Inc 15 efforts in FY21 include:
-Cost code 13.2 funding for Fire Control SSI Inc 15 development, as system is readied for its System Critical Design Review (SCDR) in FY21. Also provides funds to perform requirements analysis for commonality opportunities, conduct common architecture and technology trade reviews, capture target architecture in descriptive models; develop, build and perform a demonstration of an architecture for a System Integration and Test Environment, to support future SSI increments. 
-Cost code 13.3 funding for hardware required for Inc 15 updates to the Fire Control system. FY21 funding for pre-production tooling and facilitization. 
-Cost code 13.4 funding for preliminary Launcher SSI Inc 15 refresh/redesign efforts

SSI Inc 16: Inc 16 provides Fire Control Subsystem refresh of SSI Inc 13 components, technical refresh of Shipboard Data System (SDS) subsystems, technical refresh of Navigation SSI Inc 4, and technical refresh of Launcher Variable Energy Eject (VEE) actuators to address obsolesce to sustain the fleet.

Inc 16 efforts in FY21 include:
-Cost code 14.1 funding to perform requirements analysis for commonality opportunities, conduct common architecture and  technology trade reviews, capture target architecture in descriptive models; develop, build and perform a demonstration of an architecture for a System Integration and Test Environment, to support future SSI increments. 

TRAINING SUPPORT EQUIPMENT

This category provides for procurement of, and alterations to, both tactical and non-tactical equipment required at submarine training facilities to train personnel in the operation and maintenance of launcher and handling, fire control, navigation, missile checkout, and test instrumentation subsystems. Each training facility consists of an integrated family of system and unit laboratories that interface with a training simulation system to provide complete and realistic training for replacement and off-crew personnel, both officer and enlisted, as required for manning of SSBNs and shore facilities. Funding is budgeted to procure training-unique equipment required as the result of alterations to SWS tactical equipment, including those associated with D5 life extension.

Funds in cost code 15.1 are required for software and hardware design modification, lab documentation modification, facility modification, and design and system integration, as well as procurement and fabrication of all hardware needed to support Navigation and Fire Control subsystem training at both TTF, Bangor, and at TTF, Kings Bay.

Name.val: 1) Other Material Support- Launcher and Handling Equipment

Name.@footnote: Formerly known as Alliant Tech Systems
Funding for the procurement and qualification of Gas Generator Case Hardware required to replace cases for expended/fired GGs. Funding in this category fluctuates year to year due to test schedules.
NIROP improvements in FY21 include scheduled Americans with Disabilities Act compliance upgrades to three elevators.
Reflects increase funding required for design maturity of Auxiliary Systems Technology Refresh (ASTR) #3

Increase from FY20 to FY21 provides for specific updates in support of the existing SSP Advanced Inventory and Logistics (SAIL) system to include software and hardware procurements necessary for the system to meet Information Assurance (IA) compliance requirements.

Funding provides procurement of hardware and software for the Shipboard Planning Operational Flexibility (SPOF, formerly referred to as RT-WEG) program, consists of updates to the fire control system requested by USSTRATCOM to create a SLBM flexibility and efficiency enhancement program. Additional information on this program can be provided at a higher classification level.  SPOF efforts significantly increase from FY20 to FY21 as hardware evaluation and qualification, software development, and safety analyses begin which are required to update the fire control system.

Name.val: 3.1) Stable Platform and Housing Material Kits

Name.@footnote: Funding in FY 2020 completed factory test equipment refresh to Non-Inertial Navigation Sonar System (NSS) and the Frequency Standard module as well as a series of high complexity tests for non-inertial and inertial Navigation components.  FY21 procures system spares.

Name.val: 4) Other Material Support- Instrumentation/Missile Checkout Equipment

Name.@footnote: Completes procurement of network encryption devices, going forward, these devices will be refurbished.

This line provides funding for 16 different range safety systems that support TRIDENT II D5LE SSBN launch points for live fire missile launch operations. The various systems are on different refresh cycles causing fluctuations in year to year costs. Additionally, the range safety systems vary in size and complexity, so a smooth escalation profile is not expected.  Near-term upgrades include a refresh to the SONAR Communications Set (WQC-6), which provides acoustic-based SONAR communication between a submerged Trident SSBN and the Launch Area Support Ship during missile launch tests. Refresh of the Flight Test Support System, Fourth Generation (FTSS IV), which provides real-time data for range safety, receives and records translated GPS and missile telemetry data, and provides communications with range participants to ensure range safety. FY21 efforts also include replacement of the Antenna and Pedestal for the C-Band Radar System that collects radar data during a Trident submarine launched ballistic missile tests in the terminal area.
FY21 efforts include upgrades to video conferencing equipment to interface with Voice Over IP (VOIP) technology.

Increase from FY20 to FY21 due to the procurement of Launcher hardware at the Strategic Weapon System Ashore (SWSA) Test Facility scheduled for FY21.  Launcher Hardware includes: Shipping and Storage Equipment, Valve Assemblies, Cable Assemblies, Standpipes, Stanchions.  As SPALTs are implemented within the SSBN Launcher system, it is critical that the launcher hardware and equipment is refreshed at test facilities to match the system configurations aboard the submarines.

FY21 funds the planned refresh of the Portable Computing Devices (PCD). PCDs are refreshed every 9 years, with the first year of the refresh cycle dedicated to PCD Development and Qualification tasks, and the second year for procurement and Acceptance Test
Funding in FY21 supports refreshes of the fire control software (FCS) with requirements and design maturation plus verification and validation for FCS X56.

The TSSS Transducer SPALT efforts have undergone a comprehensive replan to account for delays in Inc 8 development and subsequent reduced scope of Inc 15. Procurement of TR-143A material and assembly, which replenish transducer stock for OHIO SSBNs, reduced from FY 2020 to FY 2021.
In FY 2021, Tactical and Trainer efforts for TR-E1 begin. TR-E1 provides updates to the navigation software in order to resolve issues arising with Inc 8 initial outfitting.
In FY21, the program will begin development of the Broadband Navigation SONAR Navigation Sonar System (BBNS).

Name.@footnote: Gyroscope units for the OHIO Class SSBNs are produced on a shared production line with the COLUMBIA (CLB) SSBN and United Kingdom (UK) VANGUARD and DREADNOUGHT submarines, and this budget only reflects the OHIO quantities.  Unit pricing in years 2017-2021 is not reflective of true unit pricing due to procurements in those years of life of type materials, and production special test equipment. Total quantity variation also effects the unit costs reflected.  In FY19, a total of 31 units were procured across all platforms.  In FY20, a total of 67 units are being procured. In FY21, a total of 35 units are being procured.

Name.@footnote: The basis of estimate for Inc 15 Development efforts are based on the lessons learned from prior development efforts associated with Inc 2, Inc 4, and Inc 13. As with previous Increments, a ramping up in effort is required as the program approaches certain development milestones. Inc 15 Fire Control efforts are ramping up in FY21 to be ready for the program's System Critical Design Review (SCDR), scheduled for FY21.
FY 2021 funding for pre-production tooling and facilitization.

Annual requirement fluctuations in this category are expected as training-unique equipment is procured as a result of alterations to SWS tactical equipment. Therefore, as alteration development and installations fluctuates, the training components would also be expected to fluctuate.  Specifically in FY21, the program plans to begin development of Inc 15 related simulation training. Funding is required in FY21 in order to meet Inc 15 SPALT development schedules.
